alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Granville; Vance; Warren (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 12 at 9:11PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1015 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of central North Carolina, including the following counties, Franklin, Granville, Vance and Warren. * WHEN...Until 1015 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 908 PM EDT, Heavy rain is beginning to move out of the advisory area and produced up to 2.5 inches of rain in the past 6 hours. Overflowing of poor drainage areas will still be possible in the advisory area as water drains. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Louisburg, Franklinton, Kittrell, Youngsville, Centerville, Ingleside, Gillburg and Afton.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
